title: Taking Additional Steps With Respect to the Situation in the Western Balkans

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates prior sanctions related to the Western Balkans by blocking the property and financial interests of individuals or entities involved in undermining peace, democratic institutions, human rights, and anti-corruption efforts in the region. It expands criteria for sanctions to include leaders, officials, and those providing support to such persons, aiming to promote stability and uphold agreements in the Western Balkans.
potential_concerns: Sanctions targeting foreign government officials and affiliated businesses may exacerbate economic instability and inadvertently harm civilians in Western Balkans countries, including international aid recipients reliant on foreign assistance.

Efforts to block property and financial interests risk pushing corrupt actors to rely on covert methods, complicating enforcement and potentially impacting lawful foreign businesses and investors operating in the region.
The inclusion of family members such as spouses and adult children in sanctions could raise human rights and due process concerns affecting innocent individuals closely tied to targeted persons.
Heightened sanctions might worsen diplomatic relations with Western Balkan nations and complicate ongoing peace and cooperation agreements, potentially undermining long-term regional stability.
